conclusion: Analyze the motion of the blocks and the energy transformations involved.
Block A starts from rest at height h with potential energy mgh.
Potential energy mgh is converted to kinetic energy at point O, leading to mgh = 1/2 mv_A^2.
Solving for v_A gives v_A = sqrt(2gh).
Before collision, block A has momentum mv_A.
After collision, blocks A and B stick together with total mass 3m.
Conservation of momentum gives mv_A = 3mv, solving for v gives v = v_A/3 = sqrt(2gh)/3.
Initial kinetic energy of block A is KE_initial = 1/2 mv_A^2 = mgh.
Final kinetic energy of blocks A and B is KE_final = 1/2 (3m) v^2 = mgh/3.
Heat generated Q is the difference in kinetic energy: Q = mgh - mgh/3 = 2mgh/3.
The heat generated during the collision of blocks A and B is 2/3 mgh.
